meanings.definition: To fasten or secure (something) with nails again.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the carpenter had to renail the loose boards on the deck.
meanings.sent2: The handyman will renail the fence to make it sturdy again.
meanings.sent3: The renailing of the old chair made it look as good as new.
meanings.sent4: She felt like renailing her confidence after the setback.
meanings.sent5: The sound of renailing echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of fastening or securing something with nails again.
meanings.sent1: The renailing of the roof was necessary to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent2: He heard the renailing of the floorboards in the old house.
meanings.sent3: The renailing of the sign made it swing in the wind like a pendulum.
meanings.sent4: The renailing of friendships after a disagreement is important.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic renailing could be heard from across the street.
